rubidium_toolkit.tools.options.name: Tools
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.options.name: Zoom
rubidium_toolkit.dynlights.options.name: Dynamic Lights
rubidium_toolkit.fps.display.name: Display FPS
rubidium_toolkit.fps.display.tooltip: Displays the current FPS. Advanced mode also displays minimum FPS, as well as 15 second average FPS, which are more useful for judging performance.
rubidium_toolkit.fps.position.name: FPS Display Position
rubidium_toolkit.fps.position.tooltip: Offsets the FPS display from the top-left or top-right corner of the screen.
rubidium_toolkit.fps.right_align.name: Right-align FPS Display
rubidium_toolkit.fps.right_align.tooltip: Aligns the FPS display to the right side of the screen. Useful if you have other overlays that show on the left side of the screen. Does nothing if the Display FPS option is set to Off.
Lowers your sensitivity when zooming to make it feel more consistent.
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.scrolling.name: Zoom Scrolling
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.scrolling.tooltip: Allows using scroll wheel to adjust zoom amount.
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.transition.name: Zoom Transition Mode
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.transition.tooltip: Controls how the game changes from normal to zoomed. Off will be an instant transition.
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.keybind.name: Zoom Keybind Mode
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.keybind.tooltip:
Hold - Zoom only while the key is down.
Toggle - Lock zoom until you press the key again
Persistent - Always zoom, if you want that, for some reason.
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.overlay.name: Zoom Overlay
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.overlay.tooltip: Renders a vignette overlay when zooming.
rubidium_toolkit.dynlights.speed.name: Dynamic Lights Speed
rubidium_toolkit.dynlights.speed.tooltip:
Controls how often dynamic lights will update. 


Lighting recalculation can be expensive, so slower values will give better performance. 


Off - Self explanatory 
Slow - Twice a second 
Fast - Five times a second 
Realtime - Every tick
rubidium_toolkit.dynlights.entity_lights:
Turning this on will show dynamic lighting on entities (dropped items, mobs, etc). 

This can drastically increase the amount of lighting updates, even when you're not holding a torch.
Turning this on will show dynamic lighting on tile entities (furnaces, modded machines, etc). 

This can drastically increase the amount of lighting updates, even when you're not holding a torch.
